channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Organ donation: NI Assembly to debate opt-out system for NI
item.description: If passed, the legislation would mean people automatically become donors unless they state otherwise.

item.title: People 'spread Covid disinformation' at Letterkenny hospital
item.description: A video shows a patient being encouraged to leave the hospital in one of two incidents in recent days.

item.title: Politicians condemn protest at Leo Varadkar's home
item.description: Protesters gathered outside the home of Ireland's deputy prime minister on Sunday.

item.title: Clones: Woman killed and three injured in Monaghan crash
item.description: The single vehicle crash happened early on Monday morning outside Clones.

item.title: Hillary Clinton to be inaugurated as Queen's University chancellor
item.description: The former US secretary of state will be formally installed as the university's new chancellor.

item.title: Covid-19: 'We want homeworking to stay in Irish life,' says Varadkar
item.description: The Irish deputy prime minister says the option to work from home should continue.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Vaccine misinformation a dilemma for young people'
item.description: NI's mental health champion says it has left young people questioning if Covid jab is safe.

item.title: Afghanistan: Further 11 Irish citizens moved out of country
item.description: Irish Foreign Affairs Minister Simon Coveney says the group have arrived in Doha, Qatar.

item.title: Covid-19: NI records five Covid-linked deaths, 889 cases
item.description: The total number of deaths linked to coronavirus in NI since the start of the pandemic is 2,504

item.title: Rathfriland: Boy, 16, is bailed after band parade incident
item.description: Two men suffered minor injuries after a car drove towards a band parade in the Newry Street area.

item.title: Anto Finnegan: Antrim great and MND campaigner passes away aged 48
item.description: Former Antrim captain Anto Finnegan passes away at the age of 48 following a battle with Motor Neurone Disease.

item.title: Coronavirus: Free NI hospital car parking ends after £6m spend
item.description: The Department of Health said it could not divert funding to continue the Covid-19 policy beyond August.

item.title: Covid-19: NI records six Covid-linked deaths, 1,072 cases
item.description: The total number of deaths linked to coronavirus in NI since the start of the pandemic is 2,499.

item.title: Teens and over 50s in Northern Ireland to be offered flu jab
item.description: The Department of Health in Northern Ireland is widening the criteria for flu vaccines this year.

item.title: Covid-19: Nisra records slight fall in virus-related deaths
item.description: This week's figure of 61 deaths brings the agency's total number of Covid-19 deaths to 3,307.

item.title: Coronavirus: NI asks for more assistance from military medics
item.description: The MoD is considering a request to send up to 100 armed services medics to Northern Ireland.

item.title: Covid-19: Mother and daughter die days apart in hospital
item.description: Sammie-Jo Forde, 32. was treated two hospital beds away from her mother after both contracted the virus.

item.title: Covid-19: Close-contact pupils 'should not be sent home from school'
item.description: Officials say schools should not identify close contacts unless asked by the Public Health Agency.

item.title: ‘The green gym has pulled me out of a rut’
item.description: Gardening is being offered as an alternative for some to lifting weights and running on treadmills.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: NI100: Stormont hosts largest ever gathering of Lambeg drummers
item.description: More than 100 drummers take part in the event held to mark the centenary of Northern Ireland.

item.title: Menopause: Women share symptoms and support in Belfast cafe
item.description: A menopause cafe in Belfast helps women who need support or are confused about symptoms.

item.title: Anto Finnegan: 'We forever, ever, ever, keep Anto in our memories'
item.description: The secretary of St Paul's GAA club pays tribute to Anto Finnegan following his death, aged 48.

item.title: NI100: The largest single gathering of Lambeg drums
item.description: More than 100 Lambeg drummers gather outside Stormont Parliament Buildings in Belfast.

item.title: Belfast African community celebrates city's Zimbabwe-born lord mayor
item.description: NI's African community holds an event to celebrate Belfast's Zimbabwe-born lord mayor.

item.title: Queen's University students within 40 miles 'unlikely' to get room
item.description: Queen's University Belfast has said it is "unlikely" to offer a room to any student living less than 40 miles from the university.

item.title: Lyra McKee: Two men accused of murder appear in court
item.description: Ms McKee, who was 29, was observing rioting in the Creggan estate when she was shot on 18 April 2019.

item.title: Donegal crash: Man killed between Muff and Quigley's Point
item.description: The man in his 80s died in the two-vehicle crash between Muff and Quigley's Point in County Donegal.

item.title: Londonderry: Taxi driver firms 'struggling to meet demand'
item.description: Eamonn O'Donnell from North West Taxi Proprietors says it is difficult to provide a proper service.

item.title: Lyra McKee: Four men arrested in connection with journalist's death
item.description: The men, aged 19, 20, 21 and 33, were all detained on Wednesday under the Terrorism Act.

item.title: NI100: Michael D Higgins' invite to centenary event emerges
item.description: Michael D Higgins says the title of the church service to be held in Armagh had become "political".

item.title: Morgan Bullock makes professional debut in Riverdance
item.description: Morgan Bullock from Richmond, Virginia, joins the UK touring company of the acclaimed Irish dance show.

item.title: Unsafe water failures 'put 900,000 people at risk'
item.description: Unsafe water entered the public drinking water supply in Ireland at two water treatment plants.

item.title: Donegal: Mica families to submit redress proposals to minister
item.description: A man whose home was demolished says the scandal shows that Donegal "is the forgotten county".

item.title: Donegal: Church leaders call for redress for mica families
item.description: Thousands of homes in the Republic of Ireland are crumbling because of bricks made of mica and pyrite.
